comment:
For future seasons, players may hold off buying it until they see a game they like.
If week 8 comes out and they find there is a game they just MUST play.
They might be annoyed that they will have to wait a long time.

So buying said games outside of the season or having the option to "Catch up" might be worth while.
Love getting two new games a week It's fun to see the purple light each week.

Having game releases staggered according to each user’s activation date rather than released at the same time for everyone diminishes the community aspect of play; I would prefer to be able to play games at the same time my friend in group 1 is able to
It would be nice to be able to jump ahead to join friends who got their Playdate earlier.
It doesn't really make sense for a console launch, even if deliveries weren't delayed.
i wish they slowed down delivery after the first couple weeks to make it last even longer
please add manuals to all games either in game or as qr code to web
It works well enough

Basing it on when the device is activated vs. when the account activates the device is AWFUL. After my replacement device arrived, I had to have Panic manually crank me up to the current week. It's a fun mechanic while you're in it, AWFUL if you replace your device.
I absolutely love having two games a week. It prevents burnout or choice paralysis.
Really fun!

I try the two games, get bored, it sits around unused for four to six days until the next Monday, another one day of fun. Nothing for side load is a killer app, or is something that I would spend more than $1 on/play for hours and hours.
I did experience a week without games, but it has worked well otherwise.
It's fun getting the new games every week, no issues with it
It sounds fun, although I don't have mine yet.  I like the idea of new games on a regular basis though.
Starting with only two games was a little limiting, but the weekly cadence of adding new experiences is great
Every week is too often for me!
Seasons should be ordered by week, not by order of install
It's so much fun.  YAY NEW GAMES EVERY WEEK until I've reached critical mass of games I like
i like the concept but it doesn't work well for me because of wifi issues. my playdate is usually not connected to the internet
It fits in the spirit of the console and the types of games
Wish I could fast forward to catch up with earlier orders so that I could be in on the new release hype instead of having to avoid the spoilers
It keeps things exciting!
I love the concept
I would have liked to “sync up” with a friend who received theirs a week sooner. First week selection was poor, I’d have preferred a “start with a bang” approach with four or six games at the start.
I felt kind of bad for people who got their system later
Keep it up, give options to slow down delivery cadence so if we're slower to digest we don't get overwhelmed.
Love it!
Please do a season 2!
Just not for me
(along with Panic) disappointed that all player's are not lined up together
How is this economically viable, omg?

I think that the season system is really fun, but I think the discussion in the discord that they should not start everyone at the beginning, and should instead move the season games to Catalog after they release so people can go buy them there is correct. Obviously that wasn't possible for season 1, but I think it would be a better way forward than continuing the current system.
Love getting new games every week
I'm in a group beyond 5 so can't answer because I have not received my playdate
It's great! I love being able to sideload games and have downloaded an unbelievable amount, but receiving a curated selection once a week is like a fun surprise because I don't know what's coming
I love the idea of seasons, but could be spaced out a little more? Two games a week is a lot
It's impossible for me to have an opinion because I still don't have my "early 2022" playdate
Being able to be drip-fed, wait not so patiently, and be forced to play some games before others is awesome!
I love it - but also wish there was a catch-up option.
It avoids overwhelming me with options, encourages me to spend more time with each individual game, and gives me something to look forward to.

The games are too lite to be released like this. Also, the quality is very inconsistent. The fact there hasn't been a season 2 announced has left me with little faith in the long term health of the platform and has me considering selling my system.
Great system. Loving having new games to play/try every week
making it optional would be nice for people who don't like it.
The blinking light is too bright! It wakes me up early.
I might have preferred one game a week for 24 weeks.
Please be more seasons!
None at the moment.
I only hate it cus it seems like it’s only fun for those that got the system. I imagine that by the time I get mine it won’t even be fun to go onto discord to talk about releases.
It’s great because it gives me to complete my games before the next ones come out, but also if I complete them early I get bored and can’t wait for the next Monday
Very fun! Love the anticipation and reveal of getting new games, discovering them with my friend and the community, and having something to look forward to on Mondays!
I hope that more seasons release in the future!
Initially i really liked the idea, however in practice I found I was picking up the device less than i thought I would as the games did not have a lot of depth to sustain a full week.
Worried I’m missing out because I don’t have the system yet
May get old for those getting devices in 2023
Not all of my games auto downloaded
Super unique and I want it to continue!
It's well done, and forces users to take room to try out each game.
love it but wish I could get more sooner when a week of games isn't quite up my alley
I like the idea & it's fun. But, I also like choices.
I don't really care about it. I want to download and play indie games.
Fun idea!
Neither of the 2 first games in Season 1 hooked me, so I didn't spend much time playing the console the first week
I like that I'm getting new games every week but my buddy got his a week later so he can't play them when I play them.
I prefer to buy games i like and develop my own games
I havent had a chance yet to really experiance it without owning the system, so I cant really answer
It's not bad but things really need to be designed so that there aren't too many droughts for people.
keeps me engaged and excited for what is to come
Updating on Monday as opposed to on the weekend is weird
I understand that it can be a bit of a hard sell for some people, but I honestly don't mind. There are plenty of games I can side load onto the console.
Good pacing and balance of games. Will be helped by more visibility of 3rd party games.
Options for people to fast forward would be nice
I give some games more of a chance than I would otherwise
Maybe a way to opt out of the delivery system and instead get all of the games at once

i feel like 2 games a week was definitely a good choice
if you bounce off one game, you're able to try the other new one
and maybe come back to the other game later
it always is a nice lil surprise when new game day comes around and see some new games :3
I do think people who got their systems later should be able to catch up
More seasons would be the best!
It's A Fun And Unique Way To Show What The Playdate Has To Offer! And Especially When It's Linked To Every Individual Giving Everyone A Taste Of The Experience.

While I like the idea of trickling out the games, I am finding I don't check in regularly to see the new releases. That may be more of not having a regular schedule that currently fits the Playdate's use case though (working from home, no commute, etc.)
They're coming out too fast haha! I don't have time to play them all, I have a large backlog

I really like getting the happiness of each Monday release, but the first few weeks were VERY slow and dry, and definitely killed some of the excitement I had for the console. Especially being an early adopter, there was almost no content besides tech demos available at the time, which was really deflating. So it’s a mixed bag from me. Seasonal delivery was fun… once I had a few more solid games under my belt. But it definitely needed some more stuff packed in at the start.
It's a great system, but ultimately I'm going to play these games when I get to them not necessarily on the prescribed schedule.
I hope that it's done again, it's genuinely exciting to look forward to each new delivery of games. An accompanying newsletter or zine would be very cool and on brand, in my opinion.
Hopefully in the future it will be easier to decide when and how your season progresses to time it up with friends getting playdates as they become available.
It works great, but some of the games are not my cup of tea
I think it's perfect - I fell behind on the releases but I never felt overwhelmed with choice! feels like a new console release
I hope they do it again! Even if not every game clicks with me, having them come in gradually means I'm trying them all--if I got 24 games at once I probably wouldn't
Still on the first week, but I like the concept.

It kind of sucks that the season's games are only unlocked once the Playdate is registered, given that so many will be playing at different times. Subsequent seasons will be enjoyable as a collective.
The games come in a bit too often for me to play them all, I am already behind
I wish we were all on the same schedule. Season 2 will be great.
I wish there were no spoilers at all
i actually wish it was one game at a time

The games come a tad too slowly? If we only relied on season 1 for games I wouldve blown through both of the weekly games. Maybe Drop one Monday then Wednesday night to piece it out more or include a longer game with a shorter/experimental one.
It's a neat idea. If I ever feel like it's not enough or its a bad week, itch.io always has a some new game.
It would have been nice to have the option to get all at once/ opt out of seasonal format. However, it is nice being pleasantly surprised on Mondays
Two a week is almost too much! I have so much stuff on my games backlog already, adding two a week is wild.
Would prefer if the two games arrived on different days of the week. But overall I like it a lot.
Nope
A fun idea. I hope they continue the seasons, and bring in more talented developers.
Would like 4 games initially, then 1/week after.
More seasons please!
It's brilliant!! I think that's why playdate was able to get so many devs on board compared to other indie handhelds.
Very slow at first. Now fun to get more.
I finally look forward to Mondays!
I think it's fun and unique.
Don’t change no matter what people say. Get to a place where we can all be surprised together when new games come out. No press previews to spoil the surprise.
I thought it was great for indie devs - owners have a shiny new device but are only getting two new games a week. Big opportunity for third party games.

Getting two at a time feels ideal. They’re usually pretty different games, so if one isn’t for me, the other will almost always be a hit. It’s also the right amount of material such that I feel like I’m *just* a little behind without feeling overwhelmed.
Love it
I love that new games come every Monday.
It would have been much better if they had more stock. Maybe season 2 will be more cohesive. I do like how you are not overwhelmed with choice.
I love it. Would be willing to pay for additional seasons.
It's great
I really like the idea but it might drive my crazy after I’ve tried it (haven’t recived playdate)
It’s okay. I’d rather have all the games at once, since most of these games take at most an hour to finish.
I think it's an interesting system for game dissemination, but it leaves something to be desired. It will certainly keep me using the console longer, though.
2 games at a time feels good, but would be happy with 3-4 per week if they were very small games (like Whitewater wipeout). 1 per week would definitely not be enough.
The diversity of games (and developers) is brilliant.
It'd be much more fun if the original idea had been possible, where everyone was on the same schedule. Barring that, it would have been nice to be able to adjust my schedule to match my friends.
I didn’t really like the first two games at all. Later games have been much better, with a few I really love, but it stunk to have new shiny with meh games that first week.

I like the concept, but I know I'll be impatient for the new games. Actually, exploring sideloaded content and device testing my projects will probably keep me busy while I wait for each week's new games.
Pick pack pup
It's really fun!  Waking up and seeing the new games waiting for me is quite exciting.
It’s unique and gives me time to enjoy each release without feeling overwhelmed.
Too slow, too many fillers
Defy content binge culture. Force stakeholders to salivate.
Fun to get new games weekly. Some weeks are boring
It would be nice if you could go at your own pace.

It skipped a week for me, and I have often had to manually download games. Also every game should come with a manual, there are several I just don't understand how to play, like the haunted house summoning game.
Don't want to wait each week
Will be nice when everyone is in sync, maybe more games per week
Fun having new games every week! Sometimes I love them, sometimes they're not for me.
Great way to nudge players to explore available games and try new things, without forcing them to do so for unreasonable amounts of time
I didn't really like the surfing game or the music loops game and that's all I have right now. I'm mostly just playing Casual Birder and making my own stuff
This maybe helps to prevent an endless “unplayed” backlog, a little.
I'd actually prefer one game a week... Busy with life :')
Please have more seasons!
Seems OK, not seen it yet as not received mine yet.
Absolutely love it
Great idea
I definitely enjoy the system. It's fun to have small games to ingest each week.
Some of the first season’s games are truly terrible
Love it, it keeps things fresh and interesting. I'd love if halfway through the season it slowed down to one game per week or provided the option to pause it a week.
Perfect way to deliver the “official selection” of games, but I also love being able to side load other games too.
A year of waiting for my playdate. My friends got it because I was a few minutes late on placing my order because of problems with shipping adress.

In the UK timezone they haven't been downloaded yet when you wake up in the morning at 8am on Monday. They're available but you have to go in the settings. I know not everyone can be downloading them at once but maybe it could be cool to have the option for priority delivery idk

Other than that I'm really liking it a lot
it would be nice if there was a way to bypass it
Personally i would have preferred another day for delivering, but it's not really a problem.
It's a good system, I enjoy the drip feed of games.
Neutral
I like it, keeps things new and exciting. I hope more seasons will be released after the first one.
I think the delivery delays kind of ruined a lot of the point of it. I hope season 2 is able to release in the way originally envisioned.
maybe do 2 different days if you keep the twice a week model
It's something a bit different, and the whole point of this console is that it's something a bit different, so I think it makes a lot of sense.
It's perfect. I'm not overwhelmed by the games available, I have found my favourites and I dip into the new games when they arrive.
Great way to not be overloaded with too many games and be surprised each week!
none
Higher quality than I was expecting!

I wish it was a rolling season, so if you got it 3 weeks late you start on week 3 games and then wont get week 1 or 2 until their week 11 and 12. Then there would be a bit more community involvement imo. Next season should be a lot smoother for it though :3
I like the thought that people may play games they would otherwise avoid if they are sitting on them for a week. This is exciting to me!
From what I've read, it sounds like a great system to gradually encounter new games
pretty great, enjoyed the most of the games I've received so far! including ones I probably wouldn't've bought by themselves
I hope it’s used for a 2nd season
love it so much. hope we will have more seasons
I'd love a way to get more of the water-cooler conversation with people starting the season when I do. I've avoided reading up on games to be delighted and surprised as they roll out to me.
It's good
Keep it up! Season 2 for $10-15!
Sounds neat; have yet to see how it plays out in practice. I'm a little worried about missing games if I don't play fast enough.
Not experienced yet so no comment
It's great! The only reason I didn't give it the full 5/5 is I find some of the week 1/2 choices a bit questionable as an early welcome for new owners…
I'm not particularly interested in it, but I do find it works well for what it is.
It’s genius. I love how it funnels attention towards new things at a regular rate without being confusing

I love the idea, but I also wish I had some consistently interesting (to me) games on there. I have a few from itch.io, but it'd be awesome to have something to keep my attention while I'm waiting for new games to come out.
I'm excited to see if more seasons will be distributed. I know Panic wants to eventually make a built-in shop.

i think it made more sense to keep the community interested and discussing, but now that third party games are out it doesnt seem like theres much point to it (also since i just got mine i cant play games other people got to play months ago lol)
I like the games- coming every week but some have been kinda meh (they can't all be bangers). Curious to see how pricing will be handled for future seasons.
The only real gripe I had was that the first two games really didn't do a lot for me - so I was kinda just waiting for the next group of games..... Otherwise, it is a neat idea.
New game day is awesome. Seeing the light on Monday morning is a fun thing to wake up to. I'm sad the season is over.
It's cool but the list quickly gets realy long
I'm not super into the two games available right off the bat, which has let the steam out of my sails a bit.
It's such a fun surprise every monday. I almost wish it could be one game on monday then the second on like wednesday to spread out the joy.
I'd have prefered one game on a Monday, the next one on a Thursday each week. Just to make the wait less painful. :)
Genius idea
I wish I could opt out
I like the weekly release although it’s unfortunate that not everyone is on the same week. It never seemed like a real possibility regardless of chip availability.

For season one, I like two games at a time because of the initial lack of games to play, but now that there are so many indie created games alongside the 24 season one games, I think future seasons could be one game a week, or even different themed seasons (ie. visual novels, sports, arcade, etc) could work. I don't have strong feelings for or against a season.  It is exciting having EVERYONE playing the same game and having a similar point of reference to talk about.
I think it's interesting, I think I like the fact that when I eventually receive mine I won't be overwhelmed with all the already released games at once.
I am generally liking the fact that soemthing new (to me) is being tried with the delivery system.

It seems slightly imperfect when unboxing to only have the first two games – in particular if they aren't your jam. 

Sideloading pretty much solves that for me though.
unique and lets me enjoy / reflect on each game. makes mondays exciting!
I'd actually be okay with one game a week rather than two. I don't find I have enough time to properly play both in the same week.
It's awesome. And you folks have done a great job curating games!

I love the season - spacing out games per week made me actually try out all of the games at least a small amount. I do wish the games came out in a different order, but overall I loved the season idea.
Love the idea & always look forward to the new game day, but has led to some weeks that feel like "duds" if you don't connect with the new ones

It's a really cool idea but a bummer at the beginning when you only have a few games - what if none of them catch your fancy? I turned to sideloading community made games to broaden my initial library as none of my four official titles have really engaged me in the same way, but offering a bigger base of games before the weekly delivery could be one solution.
It would be cool if we could set when we wanted new games delivered. Sometimes a week isnt enough and now we have a too many games problem.
I love it! Don't change a thing. How long between seasons though? I think 2 seasons a year would be ideal.

I wasn't sure I was going to like the "season game delivery", but now I absolutely look forward to getting new games on Monday, and LOVE it. For some reason, I thought there would be an option to just get all the season one games at once if I wanted, and if I'd had that option, I would absolutely have done it. But I'm kinda glad I didn't. This way, I think I'm incentivized to give each game more than one "chance" throughout the week.
I like it, I think it allows developers to reach more people with their games. Of course, a regular store on top of it makes sense

I'm still in week one, but I love the cadence of two games per week, as it gives me time to playthrough them without overloading me with a giant library all at once. I finished Casual Birder, and have been playing Whitewater Wipeout, and casually sideloading games from Itch.io as I go.
I dunno yet, but I think I'll like it!
Season delivery is the best
Given the staggered roll out it's sometimes been frustrating seeing people on Twitter playing fun games I still have to wait weeks for. I think first batch should've been four games.
Gives you a reason to explore all the games

Would be nice for the first season to just release what has already been released so far when people receive their Playdates rather than waiting the week between so everyone is caught up and can discuss without spoiling anything.

Knowing new games are coming each week, I find myself trying to keep up with progress in the games I’ve already received. I am a serial game player, starting lots of games and finishing very few of them before new games take over my interest. The bite-size games in playdate inspire me to explore and finish them, which feels satisfying.
I want it to continue… I’m sad to see season 1 come to an end I want more. Much more.
Hoping it fits nicely with the small but varied experiences the games provide. I love when companies experiment and try new things - the season delivery is a bold experiment from Panic. Keep going.
Sometimes the week's games aren't very good and then you're left without good games to play.
Love it, keeps me engaged
nice idea
Makes me look forward to Mondays but I still somehow have a backlog
Gives me something to look forward to and forces me to spend more time with games I might have otherwise moved on from sooner

My brother got his Playdate before me so we were a week apart. We had an experience where he showed me a game from the Season, Inventory Hero, that he liked quite a bit. I didn't know anything about it so it was a cool interaction where he showed me something new that he liked. That moment was cool. Although, I didn't have anything "new" to show him since he gets new Season games a week ahead of me. So its been one way for the Season games, he shows me Season games. I find new indie games on Itch.io but they aren't the same. I like the idea of Season games, it does create interesting social interactions. It does leave me with an impression, that the way this is done, is a bit strange. Why not "Buy into" the latest released games like how Season Passes work for Fighting games like Smash, Tekken 7. I guess the difference is it immediately introduces a back catalog for new users of games they'll get around to eventually (maybe stress for some?). Which waiting for the week to play the next game you know you want to play (ex. Crankin' Time Adventure) similar adds tension. Not to mention social pressure about games friends are playing but you haven't gotten yet. FOMO is strong. I think adding the option to sync users seasons to whoever has the latest week would be nice. Which would probably add a friend list or some kind of relationship ties between users. For now it's the way it is, stick to your guns 🔫 now but maybe reflect on what could be done for other Seasons.
A bit slow at the beginning, especially with the surfing game not being very long/replayable
I wish it was one game every few days vs two a week
I think it's great. I'd love a future season (maybe after all preorders have been delivered) to be simultaneous with everyone.
Can't wait to be a part of it
I love the surprise and getting a curated experience. Playing some games I never would’ve tried otherwise and basically all of them have been at least interesting, most being really fun.

I definitely played some games longer than I would have because I had to wait for the next pair of games. And then I discovered some of the titles I'd written off because they weren't well explained I actually had a fun time playing.
I don’t have a Playdate yet, so I’ll be knowing more at that time.
IDK not have playdate yet
Season 2 please
It would be nice to select a different delivery day for new games.
In group 1 the few weeks the few games didn't keep my attention for long + there wasn't as much community games created yet. Now there's plenty
love it
The notification light flashes at midnight and is very distracting. I would love if it waited til 6:00 am before flashing.
Its gonna be even more awesome come S2. When the community is in sync.
I don't appreciate that the season only starts after you turn on your console

Frankly I don't like not being able to choose my games. It's okay for now because I considered that I mainly paid for the console for the first season, but I won't pay for a bunch of games imposed on me, especially if they're not of better quality than the first season. But even then, there are games that I am just not interested in, and I think the Playdate, more than any other console, is the platform where I want to have the opportunity to support only the developers whom I like. It feels a bit corporate and scummy to have a selection of games forced in me, when I don't know anything about the review process, or their quality. I don't mean this as a disparaging comment. I understand that you want to try a new model, but it's not for me. I think a genuine online shop where I can buy my games is a must.
It would be better if more people had the system, but that's not possible given covid
Awesome idea and works very well in practice
Great! It works without any problems and it's cool getting new stuff all the time.

It's working well for me! I love the unplanned surprise. That said, I have sometimes wished I'd known when I'd get more games/software on it, but having a couple endlessly replayable short loop games on it (Whitewater Wipeout, Pick Pack Pup) has made that less pressing. Before that I was concerned about pacing myself with story driven games (not to say they aren't replayable of course).
I think it's a neat way to bundle games together! I hope that once everyone who wants a playdate has it we can all have a new season together.
Interesting, but not very compelling
Pairing one lighter game with one heavier game is nice.
I like it since I end up playing all of the games and not rushing and skipping out on ones I don't have interest in.
I like that you get something new every week and you are more likely to give each game a fair shot.
It's too early to be sure, I'm not sure if I'm getting all the season 1 games once I received my device. Piracy is also a concern from a developer point of view

Very interesting concept and I look forward to seeing what future seasons will look like! I think a HumbleBundle style could be a good way to do it - pay what you want and unlock more games if you decide to pay higher than the average.
It's perfect.  Can't wait for Season 2!
I am on the fence. I love it if each season is like season 1, but if they end up charging some crazy amount for future seasons, it would be grounds to sell.
I like how it encourages the community energy.

I previously had Nintendo DSi some years back and got bored of it because I would get tired of some games and had to keep buying more games, whereas with Playdate seasons, I could theoretically pay one price, then games get delivered weekly and lots of other people get it at around the same time, they play them, I play them (if I can actually get a real Playdate!), and we all talk about it, much like seasons of animated TV programmes and their respective fandoms (if they exist).
it will be really cool if there's a season 2 and everyone actually starts at the same time
made me look forward to Mondays
Hope for a season 2 and beyond
It’s exciting and should be used in the future.
Love the surprise
it seems i have always to refresh my game list to get the games, and this remove a little from the experience.
It's neat.
I am hoping it will help me savor the games as they come out rather than binge at the start and burn out. Getting a new one every couple weeks will be more exciting than having it pre-loaded.
Game delivery is actually awesome. Just wake it up :] I like it
You can’t see the notification light with the cover on so I missed I have new games every week
I like how it was a curated list, making it effectively "random" to me encouraged me to try everything because I didn't know what I was going to get!
No it's fine
I'd like more notice or notifications when new games come out? I'm not always on Twitter so it'd be nice to get those kinds of updates elsewhere like via email or right in the console itself.
All season one games are now released and I will entirely miss out on the surprise and the communal experience thanks to the international ordering debacle.
Seems like it got spoiled really fast. Some people are still getting their systems. Donno how they stay spoiler free while keeping up to date with the playdate news.
Might be frustrating to some. Main reason I try to stay spoiler free.
Mid on it right now. I like it in concept, but think possibly the releases should have been swapped around a bit. Week 2 was slow to me.
I like the system, but wish I could choose which day of the week I receive games!
Give your paying customers the option to get what they paid for all at once rather than being made to wait. User choice.

I think its really fun! Was one of the reasons I bought the console. After 2 or 3 weeks you really get into a groove where you don't even really think about them arriving. It just becomes a treat where you wake up and see that purple light on a Monday morning and go "oh yeah, new games."
The system seems to allow all games to get a chance to be played
I love it. I did sideload game from the start. I don't mind it will be a total of 12 weeks before I have all the S1 games. It's cool idea keeping me going back for the conceal

I wish they came a little quicker. Casual Birdwatcher and Wave runner are great starting games but I felt myself get burnt out on the latter pretty quickly. Thank goodness for sideload games or I would have put the PD down days ago

I was more excited about the prospect of discovering games alongside friends as in the initial pitch.

This time I felt games came too frequently for me to bother trying out games I didn’t jive with. There was no one I wanted to talk to so I just didn’t play. 

Early season RPGs didn’t really align to what I wanted to play.
I can't give any feedback because my playdate arrived broken and have not received any support
felt kinda slow and pairing seemed odd

I would have preferred everyone getting the games at the same time, rather than the season starting when you get your unit. I understand it kinda had to be this way with the extended delivery times across the 50,000 ordered units, I hope that there is a season 2 and that everyone is on the same schedule
Love the idea of surprise games

I’ll love it when we’re all receiving them at the same time (assuming there is a second season). I’ve been anticipating some of the games having seen others get them which maybe takes away from the fun.
Too many games; I felt overwhelmed
I like the idea. My concern is running out of data

I love the Season Delivery. I think it might be kinda cool to make the 2 games random out of the pool of games. Kind of like a Gachapon where you turn the crank on a virtual Playdate shaped Gachapon Machine. And you get 2 “plays” a week. Representing the 2 games you get for the week. Might just be a fun delivery system and a bit fun to randomize it. Or maybe even just make it an option to receive the games randomized.
I would pay for a season 2 . Please make more
I like the excitement of getting new games but who decided to make the delivery day Monday?

I’d like to see an option to pause the season incase a life event dictates you aren’t likely to be playing games at a specific timeframe. I love the expectation of new games and savoring the releases.
I wish I could pick the order of games I got to unlock.
